questions.q: Who is known as the 'Father of History'?
questions.e: Herodotus is known as the 'Father of History' because he was the first to collect historical data systematically and critically analyze it.

questions.q: What was the main occupation of the people of the Indus Valley Civilization?
questions.e: Agriculture was the primary occupation as the fertile land near rivers supported farming activities.

questions.q: Which period is referred to as the Vedic Age?
questions.e: The Vedic Age, marked by the composition of the Vedas, lasted from 1500 BCE to 500 BCE.
The Aryans composed the Rigveda, which is one of the oldest sacred texts.

questions.q: What was the primary purpose of Ashoka's Dhamma policy?
questions.c: To maintain harmony among diverse groups
questions.e: Ashoka's Dhamma policy aimed to promote peace and harmony among people of different communities.

questions.q: Which script was used in the Harappan civilization?
questions.e: The script used by the Harappan civilization remains undeciphered and is termed an 'unknown script.'

questions.q: What was the capital of the Mauryan Empire under Chandragupta Maurya?
questions.e: Pataliputra (modern-day Patna) was the capital of the Mauryan Empire under Chandragupta Maurya.

questions.q: Who was the founder of the Gupta Empire?
questions.e: Chandragupta I is credited with founding the Gupta Empire around 320 CE.

questions.q: The Sangam literature is associated with which region?
questions.e: Sangam literature, composed in Tamil, is closely associated with South India.

questions.q: Which Chinese traveler visited India during the Gupta period?
questions.e: Fa-Hien visited India during the Gupta period and documented the social and religious conditions of the time.
